basicInfo.parentCompany: Independent (publicly traded NYSE: DOCN since March 2021; major investors include Access Industries, BlackRock, Vanguard)
basicInfo.notes: Founded in 2012 by Ben Uretsky, Moisey Uretsky, and team in New York. IPO on NYSE March 2021 at $47/share. Raised $174M in total funding before IPO from Andreessen Horowitz, Access Industries, IA Ventures. Focus on developer-friendly cloud infrastructure. Operates 15+ data centers globally. Known for excellent documentation and tutorials. Introduced per-second billing January 2026. Recently expanded to GPU compute for AI/ML workloads with ATL1 data center.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: No money-back guarantee; Pay-as-you-go with per-second billing (60-second minimum); Can destroy resources anytime; Unused credits remain in account

serverPerformance.ddosProtectionLevel: Standard DDoS protection included on all Droplets

securitySsl.sslProvider: Self-managed (Let's Encrypt recommended) or Load Balancer SSL
securitySsl.backupFrequency: Weekly (20% extra) or Daily (30% extra) or Usage-based

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Outbound transfer included per plan (500GiB-11TB); $0.01/GiB overage; Inbound always free
policiesOverages.storageOveragePolicy: Pay for additional Block Storage at $0.10/GiB/month
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Violation of ToS; fraud detection; non-payment after grace period; abuse reports
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Network abuse; spam; illegal content; unlawful pornography; resource abuse affecting other customers
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: No renewal markup (consistent pricing); Backups cost 20-30% extra; Snapshots $0.06/GB/month; Support plans $24-999/mo extra; Reserved IPs $4/month; Per-second billing with 60-second minimum; All pricing transparent

contentRestrictions.adultContentNotes: Permitted at DigitalOcean's sole discretion if legal

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: 10% recurring commission for 12 months per referred customer; 30-day cookie; No minimum payout; Via Impact Radius

editorial.knownIssues: No phone support; Free support tier limited (24hr+ response); No managed WordPress; Billing issues reported causing resource deletion without warning; Backups and support plans add significant cost; No cPanel/Plesk included; GPU droplets require commitments; Some report occasional hardware failures; Limited data center count (15) vs some competitors
editorial.bestFor: Developers and startups wanting reliable cloud infrastructure; Teams valuing excellent documentation and tutorials; App Platform users wanting PaaS simplicity; Kubernetes users; Companies needing PCI compliance; Users wanting predictable transparent pricing; API-first automation workflows
editorial.avoidIf: Need managed WordPress hosting; Want phone support; Beginner requiring hand-holding; Need included email hosting; Want cPanel included; Budget-constrained (free support limited); Need many global locations (only 15 vs Vultr's 32)
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Higher entry price ($4) than Vultr ($2.50) but better reputation; Excellent G2 rating (4.6) matches Trustpilot; Per-second billing (2026) more granular than some competitors; 99.99% SLA on par with industry; Better documentation than most competitors; Fewer locations (15) than Vultr (32) or OVHcloud (44); App Platform offers managed PaaS unlike pure IaaS competitors; No phone support like Vultr but better overall reputation; Publicly traded (more stability) vs privately held competitors

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Best-in-class documentation and tutorials with App Platform PaaS and developer-first approach
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Developer or startup wanting reliable cloud infrastructure with excellent documentation and transparent pricing

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: DigitalOcean is excellent for developers who want reliable cloud infrastructure with outstanding documentation. It has strong ratings on both G2 (4.6) and Trustpilot (4.6), making it a trusted choice.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: DigitalOcean is publicly traded on NYSE (DOCN) since March 2021. Major institutional investors include Access Industries (28%), BlackRock, Vanguard, and State Street.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: DigitalOcean Droplets start at $4/month. Per-second billing (with 60-second minimum) ensures you only pay for usage. CPU-optimized and GPU droplets available for higher workloads.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Partially. While unmanaged, DigitalOcean has the best documentation and tutorials in the industry. Beginners with some technical interest can learn, but absolute beginners should consider managed hosting.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: No, DigitalOcean does not include email hosting. You must set up your own mail server or use third-party email services like Mailgun, SendGrid, or Google Workspace.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, with one-click WordPress installation available. However, it's unmanaged - you handle security updates, optimization, and maintenance yourself. App Platform offers more managed options.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: DigitalOcean guarantees 99.99% uptime for Droplets with SLA credits if uptime falls below this. Some products like App Platform have 99.95% SLA.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, DigitalOcean uses pay-as-you-go billing with per-second granularity (60-second minimum). You can destroy resources anytime with no contracts or cancellation fees.
